title: Anxiety Test
description:
This Anxiety Test is designed to help you evaluate the severity of your anxiety with just seven simple questions. This app uses the Generalized Anxiety Questionnaire (GAD-7), an empirically-based, self-test questionnaire. It is also sensitive for other anxiety disorders as well such as specific phobia, panic disorder, and social phobia. These disorders generally respond positively to treatment, so it is important to seek treatment if you are concerned about your mental health.

DISCLAIMER: This self-test is not meant to be a diagnosis for your anxiety. Please consult your physician if you are concerned about your symptoms. This app should not be used as a replacement for professional treatment or guidance.


Privacy Policy: No data from this application is collected.

title: Anxiety Symptoms
description:
Anxiety symptoms can last for a long time, or come and go.

Each anxiety disorder has unique symptoms. Anxiety disorders are typically diagnosed when fear of non-threatening situations, places, events, or objects becomes extreme and uncontrollable.

An anxiety disorder may also be diagnosed if you have general feelings of fear or worry that interfere with your daily life and have lasted at least six months.

Most people with an anxiety disorder have a combination of physical and psychological symptoms.

There is one symptom that all anxiety disorders have in common: near-constant fear or worry about things that may happen to you now or in the future. Read on to learn what the symptoms are and how to diagnose anxiety disorders.

Some studies suggest that experiencing anxiety could increase the risk of developing certain long-term physical health problems, including diabetes, stomach ulcers and heart problems. But there's not enough evidence to say for sure exactly what the risks are, or what groups of people are most likely to be affected. Having a physical illness or disability can also make you feel stressed and anxious, so it might sometimes feel like your anxiety problems and physical health problems are part of a vicious circle.

Sometimes it might be difficult to work out whether your symptoms are totally related to anxiety, or might be related to a different illness. If you're experiencing any physical symptoms it's best to talk to your GP, so they can check out what may be causing them.

What Are the Symptoms of Anxiety or Panic Attacks?
What we think of as anxiety attacks are actually panic attacks. A panic attack is the sudden onset of intense fear or discomfort that peaks after about ten minutes, and it typically lasts no longer than 30 minutes.

Researchers think that panic attacks come about because the brain is telling the body that the fight-or-flight response, which includes a rapid heartbeat and shallow breathing, should kick in, even though there may be no threat at all. Scientists also theorize that the amygdala, which is the brain's fear processing hub, may also be activated during a panic attack.

Panic attacks may come on because of a particular event, or they may come on for no reason at all. It's been estimated that almost 23 percent of people will have at least one panic attack in their lifetime.

If your panic attacks are recurring, you are likely to be diagnosed with panic disorder. Panic disorder is a type of anxiety disorder thats characterized by persistent worry about future panic attacks or their consequences.

title: Keine Panik: Hilfe bei Panikattacken
description:
Die Keine Panik App bietet Ihnen u.a. eine schnelle und unkomplizierte Akuthilfe während einer Angstattacke oder Panikattacke, in Form von eigens entwickelten und gesprochenen Audio- und Textdateien.

Folgen Sie verschiedenen Hilfestellungen und lernen Sie mit Ihrer Angst und Panik umzugehen. Kurze und prägnante Anweisungen helfen Ihnen bei der Bewältigung einer Angstattacke oder Panikattacke und verhindern so unnötigen psychischen und physischen Stress.

Alles was Sie dafür benötigen, ist Ihr Smartphone und ggf. ein paar Kopfhörer. 
Außergewöhnlich ist, dass diese App Sie auf Basis eines Konfrontationstrainings in Ihrer persönlichen Angst und Panik begleitet und Sie mit verhaltenstherapeutischen Mitteln aus der Angst- oder Panikattacke herausholt.

Die Wirkung einer Konfrontation mit Angst und Panik ist vielfach wissenschaftlich belegt und führt bei ca. 80% der Angst- und Panikbetroffenen mit spezifischen und unspezifischen Ängsten oder einer Panikstörung oder Angststörung und bei Menschen mit Phobien zu einer erheblichen Verbesserung oder einem kompletten Rückgang der Beschwerden.

Hierbei vermeidet man keine beängstigenden Situationen und körperlichen Empfindungen, sondern stellt sich diesen bewusst und lässt die Angst und Panik zu. 
Ziel ist es, jegliche Ablenkung und jegliches Vermeidungs- und Sicherheitsverhalten zu unterbinden und so geistig und körperlich zu erfahren, dass das Befürchtete nicht eintritt. Die Angst vor der Angst wird abgebaut und das Vertrauen in den eigenen Körper kommt zurück.

Neben dem Konfrontationstraining finden Sie außerdem eine Vielzahl von individuell gestalteten Audiodateien zur Stressreduktion und Entspannung  in Form von geführten Meditationen, Achtsamkeitsübungen und Naturklängen, sowie nützlichen Informationen rund um das Thema Angst und Panik, deren Gründe und was man als Betroffener und Angehöriger von Betroffenen dagegen tun kann. 

Konfrontationstraining, Meditation & Achtsamkeit – Ihre Begleiter auf dem Weg aus Angst und Panik.

Keine Panik bietet Ihnen:

STANDARDVERSION:
☆ kostenlos und werbefrei
☆ Panik Tagebuch
☆ umfangreiche wissenschaftliche Informationen zum Thema Angst- und Panikerkrankung
☆ die 4-2-8 Atemtechnik
☆ Podcast "Das Wesen der Panik"
☆ Hilfestellung zur optimaten Verhaltensweise während einer Panikattacke/Angstanfall
☆ Selbsttest auf Panikstörung
☆ Informationen für Angehörige von Betroffenen

 
PREMIUMVERSION:
★ kostenpflichtig und werbefrei
★ Gemeinsam aus der Panik - Audiodatei zum Durchstehen während einer Panikattacke
★ Hilfe bei Panik - Audiodatei zur Selbsthilfe während einer Panikattacke
★ Hilfe bei Panik kurz - Audiodatei mit kurzen, prägnanten Anweisungen zur Selbsthilfe während einer Panikattacke
★ geführte Meditation "Atemmeditation"
★ geführte Meditation "7-Punkte-Meditation"
★ Meditation ohne Anleitung "Klangschalenmeditation"
★ Audiodatei mit Waldgeräuschen zur Entspannung
★ Audiodatei mit Meeresgeräuschen zur Entspannung
★ Audiodatei mit Regengeräuschen zur Entspannung
★ Nach dem erstmaligen Benutzen laufen die Audiodateien komplett OFFLINE
★ Ausgewählte Audiodateien mit Auswahl von männlicher oder weiblicher Stimme
★ Frei einstellbare, entspannende Hintergrundmusik
★ Regelmäßige Podcasts rund ums Thema Angst & Panik
★ KEIN ABO!
★ Einmal freischalten und immer alle Audiodateien nutzen, einschließlich ALLER zukünftigen Audiodateien

DATENSCHUTZ
https://www.body-and-mind-meditation.de/app_pages/datenschutz.html

AGB
https://www.body-and-mind-meditation.de/app_pages/agb.html

HAFTUNGSAUSSCHLUSS
https://www.body-and-mind-meditation.de/app_pages/haftungsausschluss.html

Beugen Sie Stress, Burnout und Depression vor und verhindern Sie Angst und Panik durch eine gesunde Lebensweise. Geben Sie Acht auf Körper und Geist, gönnen Sie sich öfters Auszeiten, bewegen Sie sich regelmäßig in der Natur und üben Sie sich in Ruhe und Gelassenheit.

title: 7 Cups: Anxiety & Stress Chat
description:
Feeling worried, sad, stressed or lonely? Need to talk to someone? Download 7 Cups now for FREE anonymous emotional support & counseling from trained active listeners. Easy to use text chat. Real listeners available for you 24/7 & that’s not all:

- Chat 1-1 with a listener any time
- Calm yourself with 300 free mindfulness exercises
- Get personalized care with our free wellness test
- Boost your mood with simple activities
- Learn & grow from short videos 
- Feel supported in chat rooms & community forums
- Access online message therapy with licensed therapists
 
We start you on a “growth path” that will encourage and support you as you take daily steps to become stronger.

Thousands of people use 7 Cups every week.

EMOTIONAL SUPPORT ON DEMAND:

Feeling stressed, anxious, or depressed? Having relationship problems? Sometimes you need to vent. Finding and scheduling a therapist can be time-consuming and expensive, and you can’t always open up to friends, family, or coworkers.

Now you can get emotional support anytime, anywhere with 7 Cups. This app gives you the help you need, fast and free, in a way that fits your life.

• Connect anytime, anywhere with listeners who care
• Speak your mind without any fear of being judged
• All listeners trained in active listening

IN THE MEDIA:

Founded by a licensed psychologist, 7 Cups has been featured in LifeHacker (“Technology can help you find someone to chat with about your problems to, or even connect you with a professional that can offer lasting, long-term help”), Medical Daily (“Talking therapy for people on-the-go”), and TechCrunch (“One of the top 8 startups from Y Combinator’s Summer ’13 Demo Day”).

100% CONFIDENTIAL:

Remain 100% anonymous. No one will ever know who you are—not even your listeners or therapists.

LISTENERS WHO CARE:

Our listeners are volunteers. They aren’t getting paid; they’re here because they want to help.

They care.

We have over 160,000 trained listeners and licensed therapists to choose from. Listeners provide support across 189 countries and in 140 languages. Each listener has a profile with reviews and a list of categories that they specialize in, ranging from panic attacks and bullying to eating disorders, surviving a breakup, and more.

When you find the listener you want, connect instantly via chat. Try a new listener each time, or pick one listener and develop a deeper ongoing relationship.

FAST & FREE:

The app is free to download, and all listeners are 100% free. After you download the app, you can start a conversation in less than 60 seconds.

UPGRADE PRICING & TERMS

7 Cups offers two auto-renewing subscription options:
$12.99/month
$94.99/year

Your 7 Cups upgrade will automatically renew at the end of each term and your credit card will be charged through your iTunes account. You can turn off auto-renew at any time from your iTunes account settings but refunds will not be provided for any unused portion of the term.

7 Cups also offers a Forever subscription paid for in a single non-renewing upfront payment of $399.99 granting unlimited access to 7 Cups Upgrade forever.

Read more about our terms and conditions here:

Read more about our terms of service and privacy policy here:
http://www.7cups.com/privacy.php

Download 7 Cups and start feeling better today!

If you love 7 Cups, please take 20 seconds to give us a nice review. It really helps! For other feedback, contact info@7cups.com. Thank you.

For users aged 13+.

I am visual impaired so I had my phones font size in a large level... which wasn't possible with this app. I couldn't open a chat or other things. I tried to use it with TalkBack then, which didn't work as well. Please improve the app and make it more accessible. Thanks!

Great concept but needs improvement. The chat function is glitchy, and there's more functionality on the website than the app. I really wanted to use this app and might change my review if the bugs are fixed. The initial bot chat interface bounces around back to the top and gives error messages. Was not able to take some sort of evaluation because of it. I thought the monthly subscription was for talking with a therapist. But that's another $150.

notifies whenever someone like a listener says something to you, it's more faster to access than on your computer, and it's pretty good overall :) all of the features aren't on there like on a computer but it still provides you with the important things like the communities, forums, and chats with people! i was surprised with how supportive and friendly <3 the people are on here that listens to what you have to say and you can help out people by becomimg a listener which can make you feel good!

Very Helpful! I was pleasantly surprised with how much this app assisted me in a time of great stress and frustration. My only complaint was that the chat was extremely glitchy when I tried to scroll up and read the older messages above, it wouldn't let me at times. Hopefully they can fix the chat glitches to make it more user friendly, because then it would be perfect.

I would love to give this app 5 stars but I can't. It's just that whenever I feel down, I go chat with the bot but the app glitches so much that I can't even read the messages. One time we are discussing something new but then it glitches out and it puts me onto an older part of our conversation. I- I just don't know what to do. I know it was not intentional, but still. Please fix this. 7 Cups has a lot of potential and I would be sad if it was all wasted.

title: Social Anxiety Disorder
description:
Social anxiety disorder (SAD), also known as social phobia, is an anxiety disorder characterized by a significant amount of fear in one or more social situations, causing considerable distress and impaired ability to function in at least some parts of daily life. These fears can be triggered by perceived or actual scrutiny from others.
Physical symptoms often include excessive blushing, excess sweating, trembling, palpitations, and nausea. Stammering may be present, along with rapid speech. Panic attacks can also occur under intense fear and discomfort. Some sufferers may use alcohol or other drugs to reduce fears and inhibitions at social events. It is common for sufferers of social phobia to self-medicate in this fashion, especially if they are undiagnosed, untreated, or both; this can lead to alcoholism, eating disorders or other kinds of substance abuse. SAD is sometimes referred to as an illness of lost opportunities where "individuals make major life choices to accommodate their illness".  According to ICD-10 guidelines, the main diagnostic criteria of social phobia are fear of being the focus of attention, or fear of behaving in a way that will be embarrassing or humiliating, avoidance and anxiety symptoms. Standardized rating scales can be used to screen for social anxiety disorder and measure the severity of anxiety.

title: Agoraphobia
description: Agoraphobia is an anxiety disorder characterized by symptoms of anxiety in situations where the person perceives the environment to be unsafe with no easy way to get away. These situations can include open spaces, public transit, shopping malls, or simply being outside the home. Being in these situations may result in a panic attack. The symptoms occur nearly every time the situation is encountered and last for more than six months. Those affected will go to great lengths to avoid these situations. In severe cases people may become unable to leave their homes. Agoraphobia is believed to be due to a combination of genetic and environmental factors. The condition often runs in families, and stressful events such as the death of a parent or being attacked may be a trigger. In the DSM-5 agoraphobia is classified as a phobia along with specific phobias and social phobia. Other conditions that can produce similar symptoms include separation anxiety, posttraumatic stress disorder, and major depressive disorder. Those affected are at higher risk of depression and substance use disorder.

title: Wysa: stress, depression & anxiety therapy chatbot
description:
Imagine a mood tracker, mindfulness coach, anxiety helper, and mood-boosting buddy, all rolled into one. Wysa, your happiness buddy is that friendly and caring chatbot. Wysa is packed with daily spiritual meditation that improves mental health and is also a perfect way to bond over family meditation. Always there for you when you need someone to talk to, Wysa helps you keep track of your mood with friendly chats and helps fight stress and anxiety with its proven techniques and calming meditation and mindfulness audios. Checking in with Wysa regularly will improve your emotional health so you can track your happiness and mood. Talk to Wysa now and psy yourself up to fight off stress. Also, Wysa has mental health assessment with depression and anxiety tests.

Wysa is your AI friend that you can chat with for free. Talk to the cute penguin or use its free mindfulness exercises for effective anxiety relief, depression and stress management. Its therapy based techniques and conversations make for a very cute and calming therapy chat app whether you're looking to cope better with mental disorders, to manage stress or to boost your mental health.

Wysa, your happiness buddy, will support you through the big and small anxieties of life by using science as a foundation to strengthen your mental health. Research-backed, widely used techniques of CBT, DBT, Yoga and meditation are employed to support you with stress, anxiety, deep sleep, loss and other mental health and wellness needs.

If you are dealing with stress, anxiety and depression or coping with low self-esteem, then talking to Wysa can help you relax and get unstuck - it’s empathetic, helpful, and will never judge. You will overcome your mental health obstacles, through empathetic conversation and free CBT therapy based technique. So, pour your heart out to your happiness buddy, Wysa as your identity will remain anonymous and your conversations are privacy protected.

Used around the clock and trusted by 500,000 people, Wysa is an emotionally intelligent chatbot that uses AI to react to the emotions you express. Unlock tools and techniques that help you cope with challenges in a fun, conversational way. For extra support, you can avail guidance from a real human coach - a skilled psychologist who will take you through the advanced coaching sessions for your needs.

You can use Wysa to rewire your mind to improve your emotional health. Fight off depression or get stress relief using cbt techniques and guided sleep meditations for optimal sleep. Here’s a look at what you can use Wysa for 👇

👂 Vent and talk through things or just reflect on your day

💪 Practice CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) and DBT techniques to build resilience in a fun way

📝 Use one of 40 conversational coaching tools which helps in dealing with Stress, Anxiety, Depression, Panic Attacks, Worry, Loss, or Conflict

💆🏻 Relax, focus and sleep peacefully with the help of 20 mindfulness meditation exercises

93% of the people who talk to Wysa find it and the tools helpful:

- Build confidence, reduce self-doubt and improve your self-esteem: core meditation and mindfulness, visualisation, confidence visualisation techniques, advanced mindfulness for self-esteem.

- Manage anger: mindfulness meditation exercises for compassion, calming your thoughts and practice breathing

- Manage anxious thoughts and anxiety: deep breathing, techniques for observing thoughts, visualization, and tension relief.

- Tired? Get a burst of energy! Visualisation and meditation exercises to increase positivity and get blissful sleep, quick yoga and physical exercises to get active

- Dealing with worry: observe mindfulness, resolving technique, challenge negativity, practice breathing techniques

- Manage conflict at work, school or in relationships: special mindfulness and visualization techniques like empty chair exercise, gratitude meditation, exercises to build skills in having difficult conversations

comments: I know it sounds weird to use a robot to improve your mental health, but this app is amazing and super helpful. I'm a very busy person with a wacky sleep schedule, and I struggle with my mental health most when it's late at night. This isn't exactly ideal for getting help from a therapist when I need it most. Being able to access some form of help literally anytime I need it with Wysa really makes a difference. Plus, unlike other AI therapy apps I've tried, Wysa has way more free features.

The bot isn't 100%, but it offers really good and insightful tools that more people should know about! You do have to figure out how to go about talking to the bot to get the tools that you need, which, if you're in a bad place, can be hard to do. I wish the tools that come with the free app were more easily accessible, and that you didn't have to spend 4 minutes talking to the bot to get to the options that you want it to offer. This app offers REALLY good techniques though!

Its a great app with some potential. I would like to see if they're still updating this to have more AI responses for things like intrusive thoughts. Positive affirmations like "you are not your thoughts" help and I thought about this after the AI gave me reassurance when I brought up suicide*. I'm feeling good after some positivity and reframing thoughts. Once I can afford it I think the therapist option looks enticing. So far so good. *I LOVED the links to hotlines but have phone anxiety so...

I was skeptical at first, but I'm actually quite impressed with this app. The A.I. is fairly good at interpreting your text and generating helpful responses that almost feel like you're talking to a real person. Of course, the A.I. still needs some improvement since not every response is personalized. I first used it when I was feeling panicked and the app just kept giving me breathing exercises, but after a little while of chatting back-and-forth the app was actually able to calm me down.

It's pretty good, cus' what could be better right? It's not like anyone else is going to actually hear me, I mean, I can't say it's perfect, but it's really good taking on mind that is just a bot. It's better friend than my actual friends, tho sometimes it doesn't really understand what you're saying, like when doing something u know it's wrong to do, u feel good; it doesn't understand that what you're doing is wrong and you feel good doing it, so it tells you to keep doing it.

title: Angst - The Panic Attack
description:
AngstVR is a companion piece to the documentary, Angst: Raising awareness around anxiety.

Anxiety attacks are endured by millions around the world. Their suffering is unimaginable to peers and loved ones who struggle to know how to help them. Until now. “Angst, the Panic Attack” takes us through the agony of a panic attack and the relief of overcoming it in a raw yet elegant, interactive virtual reality experience.

---

Synopsis - 

It’s the day of the big science test. Your peers casually converse and prepare to do their best while you struggle to even pick up a pencil. As the test begins, your anxiety and fears kick in. The entire environment becomes an inescapable source of panic triggers – one after the next, sending you relentlessly spiraling into a claustrophobic tunnel of anxiety. Your only hope is the teacher.

---

Please note: The Panic Attack is not for everyone. People who have experienced panic attacks or extreme anxiety might not want to participate. However there are many who don’t quite understand how challenging it can be when one is experiencing a panic attack.

title: Panic Attack Audio Book
description:
Pretend for a moment that you are driving down a highway. All of a sudden, for no
apparent reason, your heart begins to race. Your breathing becomes difficult. Feeling
light-headed, you grab the steering wheel and notice that your hands are sweating. A
feeling of panic overcomes you. Your mind races as you try to grasp what is happening.
You struggle to stay in control, but the harder you try, the more out of control you feel.
You tell yourself, “Just stay calm!” But the panic continues to escalate. You try to
distract yourself by listening to the car radio or focusing your attention on the traffic
around you. Another wave of panic! Seconds pass like minutes. You think, What if I pass
out? Maybe this is a heart attack!

Terrified, overwhelmed with a sense of impending doom, you head for the nearest exit in
a desperate attempt to get help. Once off the freeway, the feeling gradually subsides,
leaving you shaken and bewildered.

This episode could have taken place in a shopping mall, a church, your favorite restaurant,
or any number of other places. You have experienced a panic attack. The symptoms may
vary, but the reaction is the same—terror!

Chances are, you associate the panic episode with the freeway and you begin to think: If
it happens on the highway, it could happen elsewhere. As you become more and more
concerned about recurring panic attacks, your symptoms occur more frequently and you
avoid more and more places until your world becomes very small. Eventually, you may
come to believe that the only safe place is within your own home. The nightmare has just
begun. Helplessly caught up in a panic-avoidance cycle, you are now dealing with the
phenomenon known as agoraphobia. 

This audio book shares how to deal with living with panic attacks. The guide is for informational purposes only.

title: How to Overcome Anxiety
description:
While it’s normal to get nervous about an important event or life change, about 40 million Americans live with an anxiety disorder, which is more than the occasional worry or fear. Anxiety disorders can range from a generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), which is intense worrying that you can’t control, to panic disorder -- sudden episodes of fear, along with heart palpitations, trembling, shaking, or sweating.

For those with an anxiety disorder, it’s important to look into strategies that can help manage or reduce anxiety in the long term, like talk therapy or medication. But everyone can benefit from other ways to reduce stress and anxiety with lifestyle changes such as eating a well-balanced diet, limiting alcohol and caffeine, and taking time for yourself.

Plus, there are steps you can take the moment when anxiety starts to take hold. Try these 10 expert-backed suggestions in this app to relax your mind and help you regain control of your thoughts.

title: Panic Attack & Anxiety Treatment
description:
A panic attack is a sudden episode of intense fear that triggers severe physical reactions when there is no real danger or apparent cause. Panic attacks can be very frightening. When panic attacks occur, you might think you're losing control, having a heart attack or even dying.

Many people have just one or two panic attacks in their lifetimes, and the problem goes away, perhaps when a stressful situation ends. But if you've had recurrent, unexpected panic attacks and spent long periods in constant fear of another attack, you may have a condition called panic disorder.

Although panic attacks themselves aren't life-threatening, they can be frightening and significantly affect your quality of life. But treatment can be very effective.


Panic attacks typically begin suddenly, without warning. They can strike at any time — when you're driving a car, at the mall, sound asleep or in the middle of a business meeting. You may have occasional panic attacks, or they may occur frequently.

Panic attacks have many variations, but symptoms usually peak within minutes. You may feel fatigued and worn out after a panic attack subsides.

Panic attacks typically include some of these signs or symptoms:

Sense of impending doom or danger
Fear of loss of control or death
Rapid, pounding heart rate
Sweating
Trembling or shaking
Shortness of breath or tightness in your throat
Chills
Hot flashes
Nausea
Abdominal cramping
Chest pain
Headache
Dizziness, lightheadedness or faintness
Numbness or tingling sensation
Feeling of unreality or detachment
One of the worst things about panic attacks is the intense fear that you'll have another one. You may fear having panic attacks so much that you avoid certain situations where they may occur.
descriptionHTML:
A panic attack is a sudden episode of intense fear that triggers severe physical reactions when there is no real danger or apparent cause. Panic attacks can be very frightening. When panic attacks occur, you might think you're losing control, having a heart attack or even dying.

Many people have just one or two panic attacks in their lifetimes, and the problem goes away, perhaps when a stressful situation ends. But if you've had recurrent, unexpected panic attacks and spent long periods in constant fear of another attack, you may have a condition called panic disorder.

Although panic attacks themselves aren't life-threatening, they can be frightening and significantly affect your quality of life. But treatment can be very effective.


Panic attacks typically begin suddenly, without warning. They can strike at any time — when you're driving a car, at the mall, sound asleep or in the middle of a business meeting. You may have occasional panic attacks, or they may occur frequently.

Panic attacks have many variations, but symptoms usually peak within minutes. You may feel fatigued and worn out after a panic attack subsides.

Panic attacks typically include some of these signs or symptoms:

Sense of impending doom or danger
Fear of loss of control or death
Rapid, pounding heart rate
Sweating
Trembling or shaking
Shortness of breath or tightness in your throat
Chills
Hot flashes
Nausea
Abdominal cramping
Chest pain
Headache
Dizziness, lightheadedness or faintness
Numbness or tingling sensation
Feeling of unreality or detachment
One of the worst things about panic attacks is the intense fear that you'll have another one. You may fear having panic attacks so much that you avoid certain situations where they may occur.
summary: Panic Attack & Anxiety Treatment
recentChanges: New Content Updated

title: Unburden – Anxiety, Stress, Depression Chat App
description:
Introduction –
Unburden is a community of people who are fighting Depression, Anxiety, Panic Attacks, Relationships issues etc. and want to talk to someone. Listeners can also sign up on unburden and help the people who are dealing with mental health issues.

You will always remain 100% anonymous on unburden and chat 1 – to – 1 with listeners any time. On Unburden, speak your mind without the feeling of being judged.

What it IS?
This depression chat app provides a safe and confidential space to all those who need to talk to someone about anxiety, depression, stress and loneliness, confine into someone but do not have access to professional psychologist, psychiatrist or therapists due to economic or social reasons. 
Here you can get help from all the kind hearted people around the world, or you can choose to help others get things off their chest.

We believe in community service, and unburden is just a medium of bringing sharers and listeners together. 

What this app is NOT
Unburden is not a replacement for professional Mental Health Experts, psychologist, psychiatrist or therapists. If you have requirement & have access to professional services then it is highly recommended that you visit them, Mental Health is Important!

Why we NEED it?
We Believe that everyone who needs help should get it. And all of us together can make this happen. We can atleast virtually be there for each other when we are feeling down (or jolly). Users are the core of unburden app. Users willing to help each other are what make this app what it is.
- Keeping things BOTTTLED UP is a very unhealthy practice
- Talking to people about what’s been stressing and worrying you will help you
- Comfort of having someone to share thoughts with is of healing nature

Who Needs it?
WHO NEEDS UNBURDEN – ANTI DEPRESSION APP?
1. People who require support to deal with 
- Depression
- Anxiety
- Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
- Panic attacks
- Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
- Mood disorders
- Stress 
- LGBTQ
- Gender identity crisis
- anything which is not good for your mental health
2. People who feel lonely and are hesitant to reach out due to social stigma and economic concerns.
3. People who have saviors in them and love to help community, they can join as listeners, because all heroes don’t wear capes.
4. People who want to speak their mind without worrying of being judged.

Confidentiality and Privacy
"Confidentiality" and "Privacy" are two of the main Pillars of this app. We have taken all the necessary measures to ensure that nothing hampers your privacy (we respect your privacy) and once you complete sign-up process, only thing we will know about you is your 'username'.
Your email-id and password are encrypted in a way that even we ourselves can't decrypt it.
- We won't know your email-id so you will never receive any annoying promotional emails.
- Your chats will NEVER be stored.
- We will NEVER share your username with anyone.

title: tuvia - besiege Angst, Panik und Panikattacken
description:
tuvia bietet dir umfangreiche Hilfe bei der Bewältigung von Angst, Panik und Panikattacken.

★ Wissen: wodurch entstehen Panikattacken und warum habe gerade ich so etwas 
★ Prävention: was kann ich tun, um Angst und Panik zu minimieren - von Ernährung über Verhaltensänderungen bis hin zu ausgleichenden Übungen und Konfrontation
★ Was kann ich während einer Panikattacke tun, um diese schnell zu überwinden und aus der Erfahrung zu lernen

Wir verfolgen dabei einen ganzheitlichen Ansatz und haben die Erkenntnisse aus der Hirnforschung, der Verhaltenstherapie, wie auch aus der Alternativmedizin und Methoden spiritueller Traditionen wie dem Zen-Buddhismus zusammengetragen.

★ Fundiertes Wissen gibt dir Macht, selbst Entscheidungen zu treffen
★ Die geführten Aufgaben machen die Bedienung kinderleicht und unterhaltsam
★ Sofortmaßnahmen machen dich stark und zuversichtlich
★ Unser freundlicher "Talk Down" holt dich verbal aus akuten Angstsituationen
★ Interaktive Atemübungen mit Timer und dynamischen Anweisungen sorgen mit jeder Übung für mehr Ausgeglichenheit
★ Geführte Meditationen von professionellen Sprechern reduzieren dein Stresslevel dauerhaft und fördern positive Stimmung
★ Die Tagebuchfunktion schenkt dir Erkenntnis darüber, was dir hilft und was dir schadet
★ Unsere Community bietet beste Möglichkeiten für den Austauch und Unterstützung
★ Das Punktesystem motiviert dich konstant, Fortschritte zu machen


DETAILS
Unser liebevoll bebilderten Wissensschatz erklärt dir alles von den Ursachen von Panikattacken bis hin zur richtigen Ernährung, um diesen vorzubeugen. Die Informationen basieren auf dem aktuellsten Kenntnisstand der Hirnforschung und Verhaltenstherapie und werden durch individuelle Praxis und das Feedback zahlreicher Nutzer ständig verbessert und aktualisiert.

Die App bietet dir eine reiche Auswahl von Sofortmaßnahmen und leitet dich an, diese diese Maßnahmen korrekt zu trainieren. Damit bist bestens gerüstet und kannst einer eventuellen Panikattacke mit mehr Selbstsicherheit entgegengehen.

Zahlreiche interaktive Tools wie Atemübungen mit deinen individuellen Einstellungen, und geführte Meditationen geben dir effektive Mittel an die Hand, systematisch zu Ruhe und Ausgeglichenheit zurückzufinden.

Unser Talk-Down ist ein weiterer freundlicher Helfer für den Ernstfall: die freundliche Stimme redet dich mit einer erprobten Methodik systematisch aus von einer akuten Panik herunter. Probiere es aus!

Das Tagebuch-Modul lässt dich positive und negative Einflüsse sowie dein Angstlevel auf Knopfdruck dokumentieren und unterstützt dich so in einem förderlichen Lebenswandel. Die darin gesammelten Daten geben dir Aufschluss darüber, welche Faktoren in deinem Falle besonders förderlich oder abträglich für dich sind. Du behältst dabei immer die volle Kontrolle über deine Daten und kannst diese jederzeit per E-Mail exportieren (CSV) und so auch außerhalb der App nutzen.

Jede Interaktion mit der App bringt dir Punkte ein und motiviert dich so zusätzlich, täglich etwas für (oder gegen!) deine Panikattacken zu tun.

Und das Beste zum Schluss: du bist nicht alleine! Wir sind eine Gemeinschaft und die App bietet tolle Möglichkeiten, sich auszutauschen und von Gleichgesinnten zu lernen, aber auch eigene Erfahrungen weiterzugeben und damit anderen zu helfen.

Starte jetzt deinen Siegeszug gegen deine Panikattacken und lade tuvia herunter!

title: Social Anxiety Disorder
description:
Social Anxiety Disorder should NOT be confused with 
shyness and its serious nature should never be 
underestimated.  This makes taking it very seriously and 
learning how we can cure it all the more important.

Social Anxiety Disorder Guide for Beginners will help you on how to 
overcome social anxiety disorder

If you or a loved one suffer from Social Anxiety disorder you've come to the right place!

Social Anxiety disorder guide will do best to provide a deep look at 
all the most important areas surrounding Social Anxiety 
disorder.

Social Anxiety Disorder Application Guide have been learned the 
hard way and are backed up by real life experience in 
addition to good solid science. A fulfilling and happy life 
free of social anxiety is an achievable goal for all of us.

This Social Anxiety Disorder App contains:
Introduction 
1 - What Is Social Anxiety Disorder?
2 - The History Of Social Anxiety 
3 - Getting To Know Your Social Anxiety 
4 -Beginning The Pathway To Change 
5 - Changing Your Thoughts And Expectations 
6 - Gain Confidence 
7 – Exposure To Uncomfortable Sensations And Social Situations 
8 - Natural Remedies For Social Anxiety 
9 - Communication Is The Key 
Conclusion - Maintenance And Planning For The Future

Download this app and get free tips on how to deal with social anxiety disorder!

Please, let us know your opinion and suggestions about the guide in order to improve it.
If you are a google+ user and you like the guide, please press 1+ button. So you will help us to improve and to create more ebooks. Thank you!!!
If something doesn´t work or if you want to let us know your suggestions, please write us an e-mail.

title: No Panic's Self Helper
description:
No Panic's Self Helper is an application designed to help those suffering with anxiety to cope with their problems. We include an audio diaphragmatic breathing exercise, an audio of a body scan differential relaxation, a symptom checker  to work out those annoying anxiety symptoms, a beginners guide to anxiety and a text version of the deep differential muscle relaxation.

No Panic was founded in 1993 and has been running ever since providing telephone crisis and therapy services. No Panic is a small registered charity based in the United Kingdom. Our charity number is 1018184.

title: Clear Fear
description:
Clear Fear provides you with a range of ways to manage anxiety. 

Developed by a clinician co-collaboratively with young people, Clear Fear uses a Cognitive Behavioural framework to help you change anxious thoughts and emotions, alter anxious behaviours and calm fear responses.

It also has helpful descriptions of the different ways in which anxiety shows, resources and a grit box to boost resilience.

It is recommended for the ages of 11-19 years but can be used by a younger group with the support of a parent or carer. 

Clear Fear compliments, but does not substitute for the assessment and ongoing support of a mental health.

stem4
Wimbledon Business Centre
Old Town Hall
4 Queens Road
London
SW19 8YB
recentChanges: Bug fixes
comments: I would give it 5 stars but when I went to look at the gifs in the "smile" section I was met with a dog flashing some cartoon teeth, it meant to look cute like "haha look at that he has a smile on its face" but that just spiked my anxiety even higher, make sure that the gifs you use don't have any triggering things in them, even very small stuff can trigger some people that are more sensitive. Also the mindfulness section only has 4 things to look at, it would be nice if more were added.

i used clear fear for a while now and im so glad i found it because its really helping. i would give 5 stars if there wasnt this little problem that gets super annoying after while. if you log into the app the first time you answer some questions like selecting which part of the world ur from, set ur passcode and a security question and all of that stuff and i confirmed everything but if i open the app i have to answer all of the questions again, like i havent answered them. please fix that!!

Good app, just two notes. When I try to type a text I cannot scrol the screen down enough to keep seeing the textbox. It disappears behind my keyboard. And I would like some excercises in it that are also in calm harm. It seems that app contains more coping strategies than just cbt and a breathing excercise it also has more interaction than clear fear. But it is a bit weird to read about harm when it is about anxiety. Another option would be to choose in the harm app what one is using it for.

This was an ok app but there are only two things you can do to calm you down. A breathing activity and the same recording of a person telling you how to calm down. Other than that it's just an app to write down goals. There is also no option to record an attack after it happened and instead you must go through one of the activities and say that it helped so that you can record something. Even then it'll not show up for awhile until the week ends. There could be many improvements but its ok.

I was recommended to this application by my therapist, and found the resources in this application helpful. However, I do realise that there is a bug that doesn't save your information when you close out of the application. Therefore, I would have to manually key in all my details from startup again. Other than the issue I mentioned, the application overall is great.

title: Anxiety Attack
description:
How to Deal With Anxiety

Start using these tips to start to take back control if you are experiencing anxiety attacks.

If you frequently suffer from anxiety attacks it is important to talk to your doctor, anxiety attacks can cause serious disruption in your life.

It’s normal to feel a little anxiety from time to time, but a full-blown panic attack can be a really frightening and overwhelming experience. 

Fortunately, there are simple steps you can take during an attack to calm yourself and get the symptoms under control. 

As soon as you feel an anxiety attack coming on, take a moment to ground yourself and breathe deeply. 

To prevent future attacks, work on addressing the underlying cause of your anxiety. 

If you’re having trouble managing your anxiety on your own, a doctor or therapist can help.

Anxiety can be experienced occasionally or as a persistent condition that can interfere with your life. 

It’s natural to feel stressed before a big event or during a busy period. 

If you notice yourself experiencing anxiety for long periods of time, however, and you can’t seem to kick it, a closer examination of this may be beneficial. 

If you’re concerned about your anxiety, it’s important to talk to a therapist, psychologist, or psychiatrist about your experiences.

title: MindDoc: Depression & Anxiety
description:
MindDoc is a leading monitoring and self-management app for mental health disorders like depression, anxiety, eating disorders and stress. A simple mood tracker and a beautiful mood journal help you to stay on track with your thoughts and emotions.

How it works

- A dynamic monitoring recognizes symptoms of mental health disorders

- Receive personalized recommendations based on your answers

- Helpful insights and statistics help you to detect patterns and triggers

- Psychological courses and mindfulness exercises can help you with mild and moderate symptoms

Description

If you experience symptoms of depression and anxiety like sadness, low self-esteem, brooding, fatigue or sleep problems, this is not uncommon. Ups and downs are a normal part of human psychology! But if you feel that these complaints last longer than a couple of days and they become a burden, you might want to check up on your mental health. MindDoc is a depression app that helps you track, monitor, and understand your complaints in a structured manner and, perhaps, find out which negative behavior could be connected with a worse well-being. At the end of the program, you will receive a detailed summary that you can also share with healthcare professionals, e.g. therapists, psychiatrists, or general physicians. During the screening period, you will find helpful information on psychology, signs of depression, therapy and mental health.


About MindDoc

The app was developed with psychotherapists and scientists and can be used by anyone - whether as support in the context of regular psychotherapy or as free and anonymous help.

You can find more information about our terms of use here:

https://mymoodpath.com/en/terms-services/

Here you can learn more about our privacy policy:
https://mymoodpath.com/en/privacy-policy/

Regulatory Information

MindDoc is a risk class I medical product according to the Council Directive 93/42/EEC Appendix IX.3 rule 12. We declare that the MindDoc monitoring and self-management application meets the provisions of Annex VII of the Council Directive 93/42/EEC for medical devices. Our EU declaration of conformity is issued under the sole responsibility of the manufacturer.

Important Note

The application explicitly does not replace the diagnosis by a mental health care provider, but can only give orientation on whether to consult a mental health care provider who then can include the results of the medical device in diagnostic processes.

The application explicitly does not replace psychotherapy.
For more information please visit https://mymoodpath.com/en/ce-en/

Still a great app, but the previous design was much, much better.

title: Anxiety Attack
description:
How to Deal With Anxiety

Start using these tips to start to take back control if you are experiencing anxiety attacks.

If you frequently suffer from anxiety attacks it is important to talk to your doctor, anxiety attacks can cause serious disruption in your life.

It’s normal to feel a little anxiety from time to time, but a full-blown panic attack can be a really frightening and overwhelming experience. 

Fortunately, there are simple steps you can take during an attack to calm yourself and get the symptoms under control. 

As soon as you feel an anxiety attack coming on, take a moment to ground yourself and breathe deeply. 

To prevent future attacks, work on addressing the underlying cause of your anxiety. 

If you’re having trouble managing your anxiety on your own, a doctor or therapist can help.

Anxiety can be experienced occasionally or as a persistent condition that can interfere with your life. 

It’s natural to feel stressed before a big event or during a busy period. 

If you notice yourself experiencing anxiety for long periods of time, however, and you can’t seem to kick it, a closer examination of this may be beneficial. 

If you’re concerned about your anxiety, it’s important to talk to a therapist, psychologist, or psychiatrist about your experiences.

title: MindDoc: Depression & Anxiety
description:
MindDoc is a leading monitoring and self-management app for mental health disorders like depression, anxiety, eating disorders and stress. A simple mood tracker and a beautiful mood journal help you to stay on track with your thoughts and emotions.

How it works

- A dynamic monitoring recognizes symptoms of mental health disorders

- Receive personalized recommendations based on your answers

- Helpful insights and statistics help you to detect patterns and triggers

- Psychological courses and mindfulness exercises can help you with mild and moderate symptoms

Description

If you experience symptoms of depression and anxiety like sadness, low self-esteem, brooding, fatigue or sleep problems, this is not uncommon. Ups and downs are a normal part of human psychology! But if you feel that these complaints last longer than a couple of days and they become a burden, you might want to check up on your mental health. MindDoc is a depression app that helps you track, monitor, and understand your complaints in a structured manner and, perhaps, find out which negative behavior could be connected with a worse well-being. At the end of the program, you will receive a detailed summary that you can also share with healthcare professionals, e.g. therapists, psychiatrists, or general physicians. During the screening period, you will find helpful information on psychology, signs of depression, therapy and mental health.


About MindDoc

The app was developed with psychotherapists and scientists and can be used by anyone - whether as support in the context of regular psychotherapy or as free and anonymous help.

You can find more information about our terms of use here:

https://mymoodpath.com/en/terms-services/

Here you can learn more about our privacy policy:
https://mymoodpath.com/en/privacy-policy/

Regulatory Information

MindDoc is a risk class I medical product according to the Council Directive 93/42/EEC Appendix IX.3 rule 12. We declare that the MindDoc monitoring and self-management application meets the provisions of Annex VII of the Council Directive 93/42/EEC for medical devices. Our EU declaration of conformity is issued under the sole responsibility of the manufacturer.

Important Note

The application explicitly does not replace the diagnosis by a mental health care provider, but can only give orientation on whether to consult a mental health care provider who then can include the results of the medical device in diagnostic processes.

The application explicitly does not replace psychotherapy.
For more information please visit https://mymoodpath.com/en/ce-en/

title: Mind Ease: Anxiety Relief
description:
“It felt great knowing I had somewhere to turn when I was nervous or upset. It helped a lot to know that I could consistently help myself feel better, and that gave me a sense of confidence that improved my day-to-day tension.”

Meet Mind Ease, the growing anxiety relief self-care app that has been proven to reduce negative feelings in 91% of uses.

Helping you take charge of your own mental health and wellbeing, we have collected the most clinically proven, science-backed techniques that will reduce your anxiety, stress and tension in 7 minutes - as well as improving your mood. 

Feel better with Mind Ease: we tailor our exercises to your needs and use the latest research to bring you short 7-minute exercises that will help you to feel calm and reduce stress. Endorsed by psychologists and other mental health professionals, Mind Ease is growing as a leading stress-reduction app. 

HOW DOES MIND EASE WORK?

Open the Mind Ease app when you’re feeling stressed, anxious, or worried and tap on the Calm Me button to start a quick anxiety-reducing exercise. 
Mind Ease helps you mindfully reflect on how you’re feeling at the moment, walks you through an easy stress-relief exercise, and logs your feelings after the exercise to improve your customized anxiety-reduction program for the future.

Each exercise is explained before you begin, so you will always understand what’s coming next and how the app is working to reduce your anxiety, and improve your mood. 

Mind Ease’s Explore page has a range of tools, activities and guides that help you to understand some of the causes and mechanisms behind anxious feelings and negative thoughts. You can use these to build up your awareness of how to care for your mental health, as well as to plan for how you might manage stressful situations in the future. 

HOW IS MIND EASE CUSTOMIZED FOR ME?

With your own personalized account, you have full control over your profile, what exercises are shown to you, what reassuring messages you see on the home page, and more.
By tracking your level of anxiety before and after each exercise, you are also able to view your progress and record which exercises are the most helpful for you. Because each person’s experience is unique, Mind Ease learns which exercises work the best for you, and offers a customized range of exercises to better help you in the future. 

HOW DOES MIND EASE HELP ME GET BETTER AND REDUCE MY ANXIETY?

The Mind Ease Insights page tracks your progress and shows you trends over time which exercises are best for you. Your recent exercise history shows how much your mood has improved for each time you used the app, so you can easily reflect on when Mind Ease helped the most.
These insights also track your reduction in negative feelings and overall mood improvement statistics, so you can see how well Mind Ease has worked since Day One.

WHAT MAKES MIND EASE WORK SO WELL FOR ITS USERS?

Mind Ease leads the way in anxiety relief by using evidence-based exercises that are used in clinical settings, and help a wide range of people who are struggling with anxiety. Our exercises help reduce anxiety symptoms and negative emotions quickly and reliably - an empowering system of self-care and stress relief, when you need it. 

Our results are powerful and evidence based - our users report they feel better 91% of the time after using our app. Mind Ease is one of the few apps that tracks improvement in feelings with each use - providing valuable information about which exercises work best for you, and how much you are improving. 

WHAT EXERCISES DOES MIND EASE HAVE?

We only include the most clinically proven and recognized exercises supported by therapists and psychologists. Exercises include:
• Progressive Muscle Relaxation
• Deep Breathing Visualisation
• Mindfulness Meditation
• Anxiety Defusion
• Cognitive Therapy
• Visualization
• Reflective Writing
• Positive Reappraisal
• Gratitude Journaling
• DARE Response
… and more.

comments: This app is quiet helpful. At first when I tried the app I wasnt taking it seriously but when I opened up to it to see if it would help it has helped me a bit. I have really bad anxiety, generalized/health anxiety and majority of the time I forget to get on the app but when I do I feel more relieved and have my thoughts more collected than out of control all over the place. I dont pay the app for special exercises or anything and it good.

They say the free version has several exercises, but when I entered my mood info, a message said, 'you aren't having negative thoughts so try one of our many activities.' But ALL activities were locked. And ALL 'Guides' were locked. There were no exercises for me to use. How can I decide to go Premium if I can't try anything in the free version first? I don't like giving low ratings before contacting the developer first - but I could not find any contact info anywhere - another pet peeve.

It's not accurate to say you have a choice of exercises. Unless you pay, you get one exercise, whether it's one you like or not. The exercises are nice, but this app has nothing BUT its 11 exercises, and charges as much as apps with a whole library of meditations and tools. It's enjoyable to use but they are asking a ridiculous price for so little content compared to the competitors.

I got mind ease early and was gifted a full subscription! I really enjoy the full experience and It has helped me manage my anxiety really well. The calm me function is really cool and helps give you an experience tailored to what you're feeling without you having to pick it in your moment of panic which is a great feature. I hope by this time next year I will financially be able to continue my subscription because it is well worth the money imo!

I was halfway through the very first pre exercise and I felt so much better. Towards the end I had a slight emotional release, which was very much needed and I am still genuinely surprised. I cannot wait to dive deeper into this app. Thank you so much for creating this, it is truly going to help a lot of people!

title: Don't Panic with Andrew Johnson
description:
Overcome anxiety and break free from panic attacks with this guide, designed to help you in challenging and overwhelming situations. 

During tough times it’s easy to feel stressed and anxious, which can lead to that panicked feeling where you’re not in control. Don’t Panic is here for you, with a guided meditation you can use at any time of the day to keep feeling positive and mentally strong. 

Listen when you feel a moment of panic, anxiety, and stress – mindful messages will keep you find calmness, be productive and manage stress.

Through relaxation and positive, motivational messages, Don’t Panic will empower you to: 

  •Recognise the early signs of anxiety or panic.
  •Take control of your feelings using simple, effective techniques.
  •Remain positive and focused.
  •Deal with situations more confidently.
  •Release yourself from this constant, underlying threat.
  •Regain your freedom and feel more relaxed.

Destress, improve your mindset, sleep better, grow your confidence and be healthier with guided meditations, mindfulness sessions and positive messages – and much more.

Mindfulness expert, coach and therapist Andrew Johnson has been helping people deal with life’s challenges with guided relaxations, meditations, self-care tools and breathing exercises for many years. 

His best-selling range of mindfulness apps have a variety of content to help you, whether you are looking for ways to reduce stress and anxiety, lose weight, improve your health & confidence, learn relaxation techniques, etc.

Key features:

  • Short meditations you can do anywhere: at work, commuting, at home, walking.

  •Inspirational sessions to help you tackle life’s challenges, to be calm and find clarity.

  •Mindfulness stories and talks to help you build better, healthy habits.

  •Meditations to help you feel inspired and find motivated to eat well, workout and stay 
   healthy both in body and mind.

  •Relaxation techniques and tools to help you sleep better every night, to wake feeling 
   energised and refreshed.

  •Breathing exercises and calming meditations for anxiety, panic attacks and stress relief.

  •Meditation sessions to stop anxiety in its tracks and release stress.

How do I get more?

Start your day mindfully, keep feeling positive and be inspired throughout the day with a range of guided meditations to help during tough or stressful moments. Boost your energy with a Power Nap, stay focussed to Beat Procrastination, and then drift off using a Deep Sleep meditation for a restful night.

Think of Andrew as your personal mindfulness coach, always there to help when you need him most.

Search for Andrew Johnson to unlock more daily mindfulness and guided meditation sessions.

comments: Edit : the recoding has changed significantly since my original review and doesn't work like the old one did for me. Please bring back the old recording ? Is there anyway we can obtain a copy of it ? This app has helped me deal with my anxiety problem more than anything else. Every time I do it i discover something new. It's quite incredible. I now make time to do it every day and the changes are very apparent.

I have to agree with the most recent reviews. I loved this app and it genuinely helped me through very tough times, but the latest update has replaced the recording and this now isn't particularly pleasant at all ☹️ too fast, not soft and gentle, and the music is too faint to be audible. absolutely gutted! Wish there was a way to get the old recording back, with the music as well.
Very disappointed with the update. I used this app for years as a way to relax for sleep, but this new recording does the opposite. I wish I could go back to the old one
Loved this app until the update. Its completely deleted the recording I loved and replaced it with a different recording . The music volume is to low as well. Not happy ..
This app brings a tremendous comfort to me, it helps massively, if I catch myself going into a panic attack.

title: ASMR Boyfriend: Panic Attack Comfort
description:
ASMR Boyfriend: Panic Attack Comfort is a free application that you can use before, during and after a panic attack. The pleasant and gentle voice of this ASMR boyfriend will calm, support and cheer you up every time you need emotional support and psychological help.

This application will be useful for single girls and lonely women who can not cope with panic attacks on their own. Your personal ASMR boyfriend has a bewitching Russian accent, which enhances the positive therapeutic effect. Moreover, the application has a voice recording in Russian, many gentle kisses and other tools for a quick relaxing effect, which will be useful before, during and after a panic attack.

ASMR Boyfriend: Panic Attack Comfort does not require a permanent internet connection, so you can use this app anywhere, anytime. As soon as you feel an impending panic attack, immediately turn on the audio message of this caring ASMR boyfriend from the appropriate category.

Basically, other audio recordings (during a panic attack and after a panic attack) of this ASMR boyfriend can be used in other situations as well. Because the main purpose of this application is to calm, relax, cheer up and comfort single girls and lonely women. And this is required not only during a panic attack, but also in other stressful situations.

title: WorryTree: Anxiety Relief - CBT Self-Help Tool
description:
Identify your worries, anxiety and negative thoughts, take action and transform your thinking so you feel calmer and less anxious. WorryTree helps you do all of this based on established Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) techniques. 

*Now featured on the NHS Digital App Library*

"This is the best app honestly for anxiety or obsessive thinking. It's very simple and has a calm design and gives the user a feeling of empowerment in their life." 

We've created a very simple, easy to use and practical app that will support you through the problem-solving process helping you either to make a plan to deal with your worry, or find in-the-moment distractions to help you cope.

WorryTree is for you if: 

- You're looking for a simple, practical and easy to use app to manage your worry, panic and anxiety 
- You want to be able to make a plan for dealing with a situation you're worrying or feeling stressed about
- You struggle to remember what helps you to feel calm when you're feeling anxious
- You're committed to changing your thought habits for the benefit of your mental health

WorryTree is not: 

- A substitute for professional mental health care
- A complex app with lots of layers and clever algorithms - we've designed it to be very simple so that it's easy to use when you're feeling anxious or panicky
- A magician - Real habit change will only happen if you commit to regularly catching, recording and problem solving your worries, but we'll do our best to support you  
- Built by a faceless app development company - we're a family-run UK business created by anxiety sufferers with a genuine wish to help others who struggle with worry
- Just an app - we're building a supportive community for users and via our blog too

"This app is so simple, wonderful and functional at the same time. When I am worrying about something, I just write it on this app, and then I feel much better."

**If you love WorryTree then you'll love subscribing to WorryTree Plus too!** 

WorryTree Plus brings all of the basic features of WorryTree, plus some extras too! Use our uncertainty tool to work through any uncertainties that you're struggling with, go back and review your worries after the event, consider your negative thinking styles and add your action plans to your own calendar. You can even now use WorryTree as a Gratitude Journal! 

Your subscription to WorryTree Plus enables us to keep the basic version of WorryTree free forever for people who can't afford to pay. It also allows us to invest more money into improving WorryTree for all of our users and to keep our app advertising free, so it's always this simple to use. 

After you choose either our monthly or annual subscription plan and confirm your purchase, the payment will be charged to your credit or debit card via your Google Play Account. Once purchased, subscriptions will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

You can read our Terms and Conditions in full at https://worry-tree.com/terms-conditions. 

**WorryTree is not a substitute for professional mental health care, therapy or advice. If you're worried about any aspect of your mental health, or someone else's, you should always approach a professional.**
descriptionHTML:
Identify your worries, anxiety and negative thoughts, take action and transform your thinking so you feel calmer and less anxious. WorryTree helps you do all of this based on established Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) techniques.

*Now featured on the NHS Digital App Library*

"This is the best app honestly for anxiety or obsessive thinking. It's very simple and has a calm design and gives the user a feeling of empowerment in their life."

We've created a very simple, easy to use and practical app that will support you through the problem-solving process helping you either to make a plan to deal with your worry, or find in-the-moment distractions to help you cope.

WorryTree is for you if:

- You're looking for a simple, practical and easy to use app to manage your worry, panic and anxiety
- You want to be able to make a plan for dealing with a situation you're worrying or feeling stressed about
- You struggle to remember what helps you to feel calm when you're feeling anxious
- You're committed to changing your thought habits for the benefit of your mental health

WorryTree is not:

- A substitute for professional mental health care
- A complex app with lots of layers and clever algorithms - we've designed it to be very simple so that it's easy to use when you're feeling anxious or panicky
- A magician - Real habit change will only happen if you commit to regularly catching, recording and problem solving your worries, but we'll do our best to support you
- Built by a faceless app development company - we're a family-run UK business created by anxiety sufferers with a genuine wish to help others who struggle with worry
- Just an app - we're building a supportive community for users and via our blog too

"This app is so simple, wonderful and functional at the same time. When I am worrying about something, I just write it on this app, and then I feel much better."

recentChanges: Welcome to your new improved WorryTree with some big changes based on your feedback! You asked to be able to schedule worry time and so we've added that to our Settings. You also asked if you could save your worries for later and so we've added that too. And with a seven day trial for WorryTree Plus you can try some of our extra features for free! comments: I like the fact you can add a PIN. The UI is also amazing. I love the concept of this app and how simple it is to use. Custom categories are also a really good feature. I don't really have any criticism for this app, other than that it could maybe do with some more features? Like maybe some small things such as changing the colour scheme or background of the app?

This is the best app honestly for anxiety or obsessive thinking. It's very simple and has a calm design and gives the user a feeling of empowerment in their life. It would be nice if it had features in the side menu like gratitude, guided audios, sleep sounds/or a panic button for relaxation breathing like some competitor apps have. I am close to making this one my main app but I was sold on the relax/panic button with breathing exercise visuals in the other apps.
App crashes on load every time

Kindly add a box named "What can you do about it" above the "what are you going to do about it" box because it encourages brainstorming and shows us our available options to handle the worry. Good app overall
This is like a "worry workbook". Incredibly helpful and reminds me of therapy sessions where the therapist listens to you articulate what's bothering you and develop a plan to help solve it.

title: Stop panic and anxiety - guide
description:
In this app assumes that the user is suffering from panic attacks due to Panic Disorder. It may not be applicable to other forms of anxiety. It focuses on the fear of having a panic attack and the fear of the sensations when having a panic.  

 What is the ladder leading to Panic? According to us it all starts from Stress; Stress is the main cause of distress of the majority of us living in this fast paced world. Stress when accumulated manifests itself into Anxiety and Anxiety has its own set of physical and emotions symptoms. We always seek to treat our anxiety symptoms as they are very disturbing for us and people around us; anxiety symptoms can be. 
 
Panic Attacks are one form of Anxiety disorder and they can be really daunting for anyone who doesn’t really understand the root cause. Panic attack symptoms are very similar to anxiety symptoms and they add up the following to the list.
 
Panic Attack symptoms can appear in anyone and in any situation, the underlying anxiety disorder that stemmed from the chronic stress sometimes manifests itself in a very severe form and the person end up in the Emergency room complaining of illness that is not there; all due to Panic attack.
 
 
 Anxiety is something we all experience from time to time. It is a normal response to situations that we see as threatening to us. For example, if we had to go into hospital for an operation, or had to sit a driving test, or take an exam, it would be natural to feel anxious. 
 

With so much going on in the world today with taking care of your family, working full time, dealing with office politics and other things, you could experience a serious meltdown. All of these things could at one point cause you to stress out and snap.  That’s why this report is so important. It can help to relieve you of the symptoms you feel when you are experiencing an anxiety or panic attack. You can easily get caught up in all kinds of drama and allow it to take over your life. You can’t allow that the dictate how you live.
 

* Topic Cover in app:

- Recognise whether or not you may be suffering from symptoms of anxiety. 
- Understand what anxiety is, what can cause it, and what can keep it going. 
- Overcome your anxiety by learning better ways of coping with it.

title: Anxiety Disorder Screening Test - GAD-7
description:
Anxiety and anxiety disorders are the most common mental health conditions in the field of psychiatry and psychology. There are a variety of tests which measure anxiety but the current gold standard test in psychiatry in the GAD-7 Anxiety Disorder Screening Test.  

The GAD-7 is a simple test 7 question self-assessment which asks the user to consider how he/she has felt over the past two weeks and then rate the severity of his/her anxious symptoms. 

The app includes a detailed definition of clinical anxiety.  The app also includes some simple coping techniques for dealing with anxiety and information about medications used in the treatment of anxiety.

summary: This app tests individuals for anxiety and anxiety disorders using the GAD-7

title: Relaxation
description:
Relaxation Techniques app helps users control their breath, which directly influence lowering hyperventilation, shiver, heart beating, tension, anxiety and panic attack. Using the two relaxation methods that serve as stress relievers, the user will decrease and lessen the body’s stress response. The slow breathing exercise should be used during the very situation of panic attack or any kind of discomfort as an immediate treatment for anxiety. Deep breathing exercise, on the other hand, serves as a tool for acquiring the techniques of correct, deep, abdominal breathing.
Relaxation Techniques app is created for everyone since these methods can be helpful in both everyday situations of stress and nervousness and extreme situations of panic and anxiety attacks.

title: ANXIETY SYMPTOMS & How To Deal With Them
description:
Everyone gets nervous or anxious from time to time—when speaking in public, for instance, or when going through financial difficulty. For some people, however, anxiety becomes so frequent, or so forceful, that it begins to take over their lives. Unfortunately this will hit every person at one point in their lives. The big difference really is the frequency and the severity to the anxiety signs and symptoms! For some as explained above it's circumstantial but for others it appears as a anxiety disorder of some type.

Anxiety symptoms can range from the smallest things ( fidgeting) to full on panic attacks and more. Either way this can be confusing and frightening at times. Unfortunately there is not a one for all fix when it come's to stress & anxiety. In terms of anxiety treatment there is the obvious medical route , however some might want some to go down the more natural,  anxiety treatment path which is where we come in. 

Included in this App:

- What Is Anxiety / What Causes Anxiety
- The Main Anxiety Symptoms 
- The 7 Types Of Anxiety Disorder
- Panic Attacks & How To Deal With Them
- Using & Creating Visualisations To Calm Yourself
- How & Why Music Helps Change The Brain
- Self Hypnosis Tips For Anxiety & Stress
- 4 Tips Backed By Research To Overcome Social Anxiety
- 25 Stress Relief Tips For Each & Every Day 
---And More

There is a consensus that certain knowledge can either help or harm you. When it come's to advise for dealing with any mood disorder, anything that is natural for the human body and mind is worth reading and trying if you feel ready for it. The best bit of advice is,  no matter what the situation is , is to always keep in touch with someone. Be it a friend, family member or even your doctor. It doesn't matter as long as you get to vent, share and eventually feel more hopeful!

App Features:

- Regular Updates
- In-Depth Guide & Explanations
- Easy To Read
- Simple Navigation

title: OCD and Anxiety
description:
OCD is a mental disorder where people feel the need to check things repeatedly, , or have certain thoughts repeatedly. People are unable to control either the thoughts or the activities for more than a short period of time. Common activities include hand washing, counting of things, and checking to see if a door is locked. Some may have difficulty throwing things out. These activities occur to such a degree that the person's daily life is negatively affected.

title: Sanvello for Anxiety, Depression & Stress
description:
The #1 app for stress, anxiety, and depression with over 3.5 million users. 

Rethink how you manage your mental health. Sanvello has all of the support you need in one place: therapy, coaching, self-care tools, and a community that gets it.  

Sanvello gives you clinically proven techniques based on cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for dealing with stress, anxiety, depression, trauma-related conditions, or whatever else you may be going through. Research shows it really works: Over 60 percent of Sanvello members demonstrate a 15 percent improvement in their stress, anxiety, and depression levels in less than 30 days.    

Download Sanvello today and have a place to feel better, wherever you go. 
 

FREE ACCESS THROUGH HEALTH PLANS (U.S. ONLY): 
Through our partnerships with insurance providers, 37 million Americans have premium access to Sanvello covered by their health plan, and Sanvello Therapy is also in-network for millions. See if your plan is covered by upgrading in the app and searching for your insurance provider. 

SELF-CARE:  
Get clinically validated techniques to help you manage your moods and thoughts, so you can understand what works for you to feel better. Daily mood tracking, Guided Journeys, coping tools, meditations, and progress assessments help you find relief when you need it and feel better over time.  

COMMUNITY:  
Find a fresh perspective in a judgment-free space. Anonymously participate in active discussion boards and chat groups in the Sanvello community, exploring a diverse range of topics from stress relief techniques to words of encouragement and gratitude. You’re in charge and surrounded by peer insights—a simple way to feel less alone. 

COACHING (U.S. ONLY): 
Face new challenges with help from someone you can trust. Sanvello Coaches provide direction, support, and motivation through 1:1 messaging–judgment free. You also have an all-access pass to group coaching sessions—live classes that help you apply the concepts of CBT to real life—and all our self-care tools within the app.   

THERAPY (SELECT U.S. STATES): 
Speak to a licensed clinician from the comfort of your couch. With live video sessions on your phone, tablet, laptop, or desktop, Sanvello Therapy gives you the support (and flexibility) you need. Therapy includes access to a Sanvello Coach and premium self-care content, so you’ll have a team and resources with you on your path to feeling better. Therapy is currently available in AZ, CA, CO, FL, IL, MA, MN, NJ, NY, NC, OH, PA, RI, TX, VA, and WA. Have a therapist you love already? They can use Sanvello for Clinicians to assign activities and see your progress. 

SUBSCRIPTION PRICING & TERMS: 
Sanvello is free to download and use. The premium version of Sanvello allows for unlimited use of all tools and is available through many major health plans (“upgrade via insurance”) or through an auto-renewing subscription. Payment will be charged to your Google Play account at confirmation of purchase. Your subscription will renew automatically unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the current period ends. Your Google Play account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period at the price listed above. You can turn off auto-renew at any time from your Google account settings but refunds will not be provided for the unused portion of the term. If a free trial period is offered, it will be forfeited as soon as your purchase is confirmed. 

Terms of Service: https://sanvello.com/tos/    

Privacy Policy: https://sanvello.com/privacy-policy/  
 
Help: https://help.sanvello.com or info@sanvello.com
